isis.stitle: FRAME - BOLT AND TORQUE INFORMATION - HUCK-SPIN FASTENERS

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: Huck-Spin fasteners are used in various positions in frame rail construction. The installed fastener has a collar that is cold-worked or swaged over the grooved pin Figure 13. Advantages to this style fastener are consistent clamp load and a high resistance to loosening due to vibration. The need to recheck fastener torque is eliminated.

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: The collar cannot be removed by twisting or hammering. The collar must be cut longitudinally to the extent of the swaged section. This can be accomplished with a small wheel grinder (Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Cutting Collar with Wheel Grinder

svcsubproc.para: Drilling on opposite sides of the collar may also be used (Figure 15).
Another method of splitting the collar is to chisel the walls of the collar (Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Using a Chisel to Split the Collar

svcsubproc.para: When the collar has been opened over the length of the swaged portion on two opposite sides ( Figure 17), the fastener can be removed. The fastener may need to be hammered to remove the collar.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Collar with Reliefs for Removal

svcsubproc.para: In the event the collar doesn't come loose, use a chisel or suitable tool to peel the collar sections back ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Collar Peeled Back to Assist Removal

svcsubproc.para: The fastener will come free when sufficient collar material has been pulled away ( Figure 19).

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: The Huck-Spin is installed by spinning the collar onto the fastener. The pulling action of the Huck-Spin installation tool swages the collar into the grooves of the fastener and then automatically disengages from the fastener ( Figure 20).
